page.title: 20The Old Hall
page.content: The most interesting building in Gainsborough is the Old Hall.It stands near the centre of the town,and was built in the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries by the Burgh family.It was purchased by William Hickman in 1597 and was occupied by his descendants until Thonock Hall (since demolished) was built in the eighteenth century. The Old Hall is built mainly of brick,timber and plaster,there being little available local stone.Inside there is an impressive great hall which is still used for local functions,and a fine mediaeval kitchen,with the original large fireplaces and ovens.Also of interest is the primitive toilet.Henry the Eighth was supposed to have met his last wife,Catherine Parr at the Hall. It is reputedly haunted by the "Grey Lady".
